summary: A colonel is a rank of officer in the military.
full_text:
This article is about the OF-5 rank Colonel in Anglophone countries. For the equivalent rank in Slavophone armed forces see Polkovnik; in Austria and Germany see Oberst.

Colonel  is a senior military officer rank below the general officer ranks. However, in some small military forces, such as those of Iceland or the Vatican, colonel is the highest rank. It is also used in some police forces and paramilitary organizations.
Historically, in the seventeenth, eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, a colonel was typically in charge of a regiment in an army. Modern usage varies greatly.
The rank of colonel is typically above the rank of lieutenant colonel. The rank above colonel is typically called brigadier, brigade general or brigadier general.
Equivalent naval ranks may be called captain or ship-of-the-line captain. In the Commonwealth air force rank system, the equivalent rank is group captain.
title: Colonel
